intro: Hebeclinium sordidum, commonly known as the dirty hebeclinium, is a rare and lesser-known plant species belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically range in color from pale yellow to brownish hues. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of pubescence. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in temperate regions with cool, humid climates. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
